image.altText: A young man with dark hair, a beard, a suit and glasses walks on the street.

props.synopsis: Network Ten applies for a last-minute application to introduce new evidence in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against the company and its journalist Lisa Wilkinson, just days before the judgement was due to be handed down.

title.children: Network Ten makes eleventh-hour application to introduce new evidence in Bruce Lehrmann defamation case

image.altText: A man points while a woman smiles

props.synopsis: As King Charles tries to keep an ancient institution going in a modern world, he might have to rethink his stance on the importance of history, heritage and glamour.

title.children: 'Doesn't sound like a good idea': The king's sister warned of a princess shortage long before Kate fell ill

image.altText: A group of performers at an outdoor festival.

props.synopsis: Whether extreme weather, increasing costs or poor ticket sales, Australia's festival industry is having a hard time of it at the moment â€” but the National Folk Festival is underway in Canberra after "strong" ticket sales.

title.children: National Folk Festival underway in Canberra during a 'tough time' for festivals

image.altText: Do you know where the Monopoly boardgame comes from?

props.synopsis: Have you played Monopoly? The boardgame was designed to teach us about rents. Some economists say if we took rents seriously we could solve many problems.

title.children: What do land tax, Monopoly, and Australia have in common?

image.altText: A woman holding a photograph f a traditional Indigenous man

props.synopsis: Sylvia Tkac was watching ABC News when she saw something shocking. Now the breakthrough identification of her great-grandfather is shedding light on a little-known chapter of Australia's history, involving international romance, mysterious gold teeth and long-lost family.

title.children: A young man's story of love and loss has solved a history mystery. It is also helping rewrite Australia's origin story

image.altText: A young girl sitting with a basket of easter eggs

props.synopsis: Australians young and old have flocked to church services to mark Easter Sunday, and spent the morning enjoying some Easter treats.Â

title.children: Australians celebrate Easter Sunday, with full congregations across the country

image.altText: pictures of Lesley trotter overlaid on photos of the search for her remains

props.synopsis: Lesley Trotter's disappearance sparked a large-scale search of Brisbane bushland. Then a grim discovery was made just metres from her front door.Â

title.children: Lesley Trotter's disappearance sparked a major search, but police would make a grim discovery closer to home

image.altText: Tim Tszyu fights Sebastian Fundora in Las Vegas

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu's dreams of becoming a unified boxing world champion end in a bloody title fight in Las Vegas, with the Australian losing in 12 rounds to Sebastian Fundora.

title.children: Tim Tszyu loses world title in bloody Las Vegas split decision

image.altText: A Richmond player smiles in triumph as he hangs in the arms of a teammate after a goal in a big game.

props.synopsis: Richmond hangs on to beat Sydney in an MCG thriller for the Tigers' first win in 2024, after the Western Bulldogs obliterates the West Coast Eagles down the road at Docklands. Follow live.

title.children: Tigers time at the MCG as Richmond beat Swans in MCG thriller, Bulldogs smash struggling Eagles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: Richmond win! They've beaten Sydney by five points!
3QT: Tigers lead Swans by 16 point and threaten a massive boilover
St Kilda's Marcus Windhager facing one-game ban

image.altText: Jack Williams celebrates

props.synopsis: An undermanned Cronulla side will lock horns with the Raiders in the Shire. Earlier, the Warrios outpointed the Knights in Auckland. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Sharks take on Raiders after Warriors take down Knights in Auckland

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: You again? Still convinced youâ€™d outperform actual Hard Quiz contestants? We'll see about that. Letâ€™s playâ€¦. HARD!

title.children: Think you know a thing or two about quizzes? I'll be the judge of that... Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: a man sits inside a nsw ambulance after being rescued from the jenolan caves

props.synopsis: The pair were among six people trekking through the Jenolan Caves in the NSW Central Tablelands on Saturday night, when they became stuck in a tight and narrow spot.

title.children: Two people trapped for 10 hours in cave freed after 'extremely difficult' rescue

image.altText: A beach with white sand, with the ocean on the left and dunes on the right.

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old man slipped from rocks in Cape Arid National Park on Saturday afternoon and has not been seen since. Meanwhile, a woman has been rescued by a bystander near Albany.

title.children: Search resumes for man who fell off rocks in remote WA national park, while woman is rescued near Albany

image.altText: A woman in a red top in front of a photograph of a woman in a white top and black cardigan

props.synopsis: How do you go on when you lose someone you love in a flash, a blink, a moment? When they go to the shops and never return? In the immediate aftermath, is it even possible?

title.children: Vyleen White was killed in a freak attack. Two things kept her daughter Cindy afloat

image.altText: A man sits on rocks next to a river with three emergency workers standing beside him

props.synopsis: It's believed there are many more rescues in wilderness areas than publicly reported, and experienced bushwalkers should reassess their preparation for hikes in areas affected by heavy regrowth, one experienced guide warns.

title.children: Bushwalker Andy Collins is horrified he almost made a decision that would have made his rescue a 'body recovery'

image.altText: Composite image of Caitlin Clark and Angel Reese in the NCAA tournament.

props.synopsis: As Caitlin Clark's Iowa and Angel Reese's LSU teams prepare for a rematch of their national championship game, the rivalry between them is doing untold good for women's sports in the US.

title.children: The basketball rivalry highlighting racial double standards and the rising tide of superstar women athletes in the US

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a balaclava inspecting a gun pointed at the ground.

props.synopsis: Guns and weaponry from the United States are fuelling gang terror over locals in Haiti. Now the Haitian expat community in Florida is calling for the US to do more to stop the flow of weapons outside the country.

title.children: Fearsome gangs are ruling Haiti with a devilish ransom strategy. But who is sending their weapons?

image.altText: UN truck near the Israel-Lebanon border

props.synopsis: Lebanese media report an Israeli drone strike targeted UN observers patrolling Lebanon's southern border, but the Israeli military denies striking a UN vehicle in the area.Â

title.children: 'The targeting of peacekeepers is unacceptable': UN condemns blast that injured Australian and two other observers

image.altText: A small white gadget

props.synopsis: Authorities warn new technology arriving in Australia with a cute cartoon mascot has the potential to allow tech-savvy thieves to steal property with the click of a button.

title.children: It looks 'like a little gaming device', but police say this gadget can allow hackers to break into your car and home

image.altText: Ute flooded in campsite

props.synopsis: A group of campers remain stranded at an outback campsite near Mount Isa, with surrounding waters set to continue rising after authorities rescued two mothers and three infants.Â Â

title.children: Outback campers wake to find their swags floating as they are cut off by Queensland flash floods

image.altText: The vascular system of a piece of wood infested by shot hole borer beetles

props.synopsis: The polyphagous shot-hole borer is destroying trees in Perth's iconic parks, and there are fears it could cause an economic disaster should it cross the Nullarbor.

title.children: 'It's devastating': A tiny pest is ruining Perth trees and could cause an economic disaster if it spreads east

image.altText: bald man with short beard wears a dark suit and glasses. he holds a hand over his chest.

props.synopsis: When Moby was last in Australia, he played the most embarrassing show of his life. The DJ and producer reflects on that gig â€”Â and the broader power of house music â€” with Double J's Tim Shiel.

title.children: 'Like seeing Led Zeppelin, followed by their accountant': Moby on his 'embarrassing' Australian show

image.altText: A teenager with shirt off throws a punch with gloves on, and hits pads held by another teenager with shirt on

props.synopsis: The declaration of a two-week youth curfew in Alice Springs to curb crime andÂ antisocial behaviour has been called a "circuit-breaker" by some and a "punitive" response by others. ButÂ one thing almost everyone agrees on is the need for medium and long-term solutions to tackle the town's issues.

title.children: Calls for long-term solutions in Alice Springs after two-week youth curfew ends

image.altText: Humanitarian aid is airdropped to Palestinians

props.synopsis: An aid delivery in Gaza has descended into chaos with shots fired and five people reportedly killed, as almost six months of Israeli bombardment has left hundreds of thousands of civilians in desperate need.

title.children: Another aid delivery in Gaza turns deadly, as UN warns famine is imminent in northern areas

image.altText: Three people smile and pose for a photo in a dance studio, two people use a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Dom Tulleken runs a dance academy for people with a disability. He encourages people to be their true selves â€” an ethos he lives by.

title.children: Dom runs a dance academy encouraging people be their true selves â€“ it's an ethos he lives by

image.altText: A man grins into the camera while a car is put on a barge

props.synopsis: Matt Wright has been a powerhouse of the Top Endâ€™s tourism industry for years. But in the wake of the crash death of his Netflix co-star, some of his businesses have been folded.

title.children: Major brands put Outback Wrangler on ice in wake of crash death

image.altText: An aerial view of a beach, land, and the ocean. A vehicle is on the beach.

props.synopsis: For many generations, driving along the beach has been a cherished way of life.Â But with 4WD sales increasing,Â more Australians are reportedly driving on beachesÂ and there's concern that's further impacting the natural dynamics of our coastlines.

title.children: Taking your 4WD to the beach? Here's how to avoid getting bogged in the soft sand

image.altText: Chance Perdomo attends a premier. He's standing with a white suit on and black tie.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old actor was killed in a motorcycle accident with no other parties involved, his representatives said in a statement.

title.children: Chance Perdomo, star of Gen V and Chilling Adventures of Sabrina, dies in motorcycle accident

image.altText: Teen skaters Chloe Covell (left) and Arisa Trew have their eyes set on an Australian Olympic record set by Sandra Morgan-Beavis

props.synopsis: Australia's youngest Olympic medal winner has held her title for 68 years. Now, Queensland skateboarding prodigies have their eyes set on breaking that record.

title.children: This teen watched the Olympics, dreaming big. Now she's on the cusp of breaking a 68-year record

image.altText: Hands scoop up cocoa beans

props.synopsis: Chocolatier Darryl Kirk says he can taste the rainforest in his Australian chocolate grown near the gateway to the Daintree National Park.

title.children: Australian, Pacific regions tipped to become world leaders in boutique chocolate market

image.altText: Lizzie Eastham smiles as a black dog licks her face.

props.synopsis: Lizzie Eastham was born without sight but loves to wear make up â€” and wants it to be more accessible for people with vision impairments.

title.children: 'Lack of sight does not mean lack of pride': People with vision impairment call for more accessible beauty products
